channel.title: silkscreen on MMINT.UK
channel.description: Recent content in silkscreen on MMINT.UK

item.title: CMYK & RGB Ultraviolet Night Photography Silkscreen Print Collection | MMINT.UK | Rob Green | Noe Alonzo - Neon Japan
item.description: Check out this nighttime cityscape collection of photographic silkscreen prints I made in collaboration with @noealzii. Developing an original printing method that combines both the CMYK & RGB printing processes as well as using ultraviolet inks on black paper allowed for some truly experimental printing that gave us some extremely interesting variants and really brought his work to life!

item.title: ▶️ The Making of an Ultraviolet Silkscreen Photography Print | Collaboration with Noe Alonzo - Neon Cityscape, Seoul
item.description: For this collaboration I looked into the best method to print the nighttime shot from Noe Alonzo. I decided it would be great to utilise a black paper as it’s a nighttime shot. The next challenge was to figure out the best method to execute the print. For this I used a custom Ultraviolet white ink I had been developing from a recent mural commission along with neon yellow, cyan & magenta.

item.title: ▶️ The Making of an Ultraviolet Silkscreen Photography Print | Noe Alonzo - Hong Kong
item.description: For this collaboration I looked into the best method to print the daytime shot from Noe Alonzo. As the original photograph predominantly uses magenta & cyan I decided to print half the run without the yellow layer which would amplify the pinks within the image and half with yellow layer to bring out more reds. I added a metalic powder into an additional layer to accentuate the image and add a more unique and magical element to the print which is inline with the initial appeal of the photograph.

item.title: 'Huitzilopochtli' | A Story of Wrath, Retribution & Triumph..
item.description: Our story begins with Coatlique, the earth goddess, mother to Coyolxanuhqui, goddess of the moon and to her male children, the gods of the stars. While upon Serpent Mountain she finds a ball of feathers and tucks it in her bosom. She looks for it later, but finds it missing. Coatlique realises she is pregnant and begins to tell her children the story of what had happened, but they do not believe her.

item.title: 'Tiger Balm' | Tee Exhibition | MMMRecords, Itaewon, Seoul, S.Korea
item.description: ‘Tiger Balm’ tee, part of a t-shirt exhibition at @mmmrecords Itaewon, Seoul. Huge thanks to @dekal for making all the tees and setting up the exhibition! absolute legend! The second part of the exhibition was intended to take place at @yesultong but unfortunately had to be cancelled due to covid restrictions, hopefully we can set something else up soon to take it’s place in the near future!

item.title: 'Sexy Beast' | Film 4 | "I know a bloke, who knows a bloke, who knows a bloke"
item.description: SexyBeast directed by Jonathan Glazer, film4 Production Featuring Ray Winstone BenKingsley & IanMcShane. Film Poster illustration for a silkscreen print. Don: Yes! Gal: No! Don: Yes! Gal: No! Don: Fat cunt! Gal: No, No, No! Don: Yes, Yes, Yes!

item.title: ▶️ 'IKAROA' | Ultraviolet Silkscreen Printing Video
item.description: I K A R O A - Two colour ultraviolet silkscreen print. Taking its name from the Maori word for ‘the long fish that gave birth to all the stars in the Milky Way’ depicts a carp, bringing together Japanese and Maori culture within a retro framework. Tune by: Chaos In The CBD - Dusty Sundays

item.title: 'I K A R O A' | B&W & ULTRAVIOLET
item.description: I K A R O A - Framed, two colour silkscreen print. Taking its name from the Maori word for ‘the long fish that gave birth to all the stars in the Milky Way’ depicts a carp, bringing together Japanese and Maori culture within a retro framework.silkscreen print.

item.title: 'I K A R O A' | Illustration & Colour Variations
item.description: I K A R O A - Framed, two colour silkscreen print. Taking its name from the Maori word for ‘the long fish that gave birth to all the stars in the Milky Way’ depicts a carp, bringing together Japanese and Maori culture within a retro framework. silkscreen print.

item.title: 'Vishnu' | Illustration
item.description: Vishnu is the Preserver and guardian of men (Narayana), he protects the order of things (dharma) and, when necessary, he appears on earth in various incarnations or avatars to fight demons and fierce creatures and so maintain cosmic harmony.

item.title: Vans Apgujeong Grand Opening | Seoul, S.Korea
item.description: Illustration for Apgujeong Vans Store grand opening, Seoul, S.Korea.

item.title: 'House of Vans' | Event 2014 | Seoul, S.Korea
item.description: Illustration for ‘House Of Vans’ Event 2014. Thanks for the sweet shoes!
